title:
Knowledge Defined Networking for 6G: A Reinforcement Learning Example
  for Resource Management
authors: Erol Koçoğlu, Mehmet Ozdem, Tuğçe Bilen
summary: The article discusses the need for AI-powered network designs to handle 6G's demands, proposing Knowledge-Defined Networking (KDN) as a solution. KDN aims to optimize resource management using Reinforcement Learning.
key_points: AI-powered network design
Knowledge-Defined Networking (KDN)
Reinforcement Learning for resource management

title:
Toward an Unbiased Collective Memory for Efficient LLM-Based Agentic 6G
  Cross-Domain Management
authors: Hatim Chergui, Miguel Catalan Cid, Pouria Sayyad Khodashenas, Daniel Camps Mur, Christos Verikoukis
summary: A novel framework for proactive cross-domain resource orchestration in 6G RAN-Edge networks using LLM-augmented agents is introduced, featuring an unbiased memory design to mitigate cognitive biases.
key_points: Agents use advanced reasoning and planning capabilities
Unbiased memory design minimizes confirmation, availability, primacy, and recency biases
Memory design enables learning from both successful and failed strategies
Results show 4.5x reduction in unresolved negotiations compared to non-memory baselines

title:
Transmitter-Side Beyond-Diagonal RIS-Enabled Integrated Sensing and
  Communications
authors: Kexin Chen, Yijie Mao, Wonjae Shin
summary: This paper proposes a novel integrated sensing and communication framework using Beyond Diagonal Reconfigurable Intelligent Surfaces (BD-RIS) at the transmitter, aiming to enhance sensing and communication performance.
key_points: BD-RIS improves electromagnetic wave propagation control
Jointly optimizes active beamforming and scattering matrix for sensing targets and maximizing sum rate
Proposes a low-complexity iterative algorithm for efficient solution
Offers enhanced dual-functional performance while reducing computational complexity

title: Joint Communication and Parameter Estimation in MIMO Channels
authors: Gökhan Yılmaz, Franz Lampel, Hamdi Joudeh, Giuseppe Caire
summary: Article studies joint communication and sensing with multiple antennas, establishing a capacity-MSE function to optimize coding schemes. It showcases optimal schemes and trade-offs in two practical scenarios.
key_points: Joint communication and sensing setting
Capacity-MSE function
Optimal coding schemes
Practical scenario applications

title:
Peculiarities of spin dynamics excitation by magnetic field of a
  high-frequency electromagnetic pulse
authors: Nika Gribova, Anatoly Zvezdin, Vladimir Belotelov
summary: Researchers developed a unified theoretical framework to study THz electromagnetic pulses on ferromagnetic materials, revealing optimal pulse durations for spin precession excitation and dependency on magnetic parameters and external fields.
key_points: Optimal pulse duration depends on sample and field parameters
Circular polarization enhances rectified magnetic field effect
Short pulses can excite free spin precession regardless of polarization

title:
Neural Network-Based Single-Carrier Joint Communication and Sensing:
  Loss Design, Constellation Shaping and Precoding
authors: Charlotte Muth, Benedikt Geiger, Daniel Gil Gaviria, Laurent Schmalen
summary: This article investigates the impact of higher-order modulation formats on single-carrier joint communication and sensing systems. It explores the performance of autoencoder-based systems with multi-snapshot sensing and varying signal-to-noise ratio.
key_points: Neural networks outperform classical algorithms in low SNR conditions
Multi-snapshot sensing reduces gap in sensing performance between classical and shaped modulation formats
System extension to multi-user multiple-input multiple-output improves spatial efficiency
Importance of estimation bounds for training neural networks in varying SNR conditions highlighted

title: Ukrainian Wartime Astronomy and its Prospects
authors: Danilo Albergaria, Kateryna Frantseva, Pedro Russo, Svitlana Babiichuk, Oksana Berezhna, Sofiia Denyshchenko, Daria Dobrycheva, Vadym Kaydash, Olena Kompaniiets, Oleksander Konovalenko, Yurii Kulinich, Igor Lukyanyk, Vladyslava Marsakova, Bohdan Novosyadlyj, Elena Panko, Volodymyr Reshetnyk, Ivan Slyusarev, Iurii Sushch, Ganna Tolstanova, Iryna Vavilova, Liubov Yankiv-Vitkovska, Yaroslav Yatskiv, Vyacheslav Zakharenko
summary: Astronomical facilities damaged by the Russian invasion of Ukraine are being restored with a focus on international community integration.
key_points: Facilities compromised by war
Researchers displaced
International community integration plan developed
Restoration efforts underway

title: HilbertA: Hilbert Attention for Image Generation with Diffusion Models
authors: Shaoyi Zheng, Wenbo Lu, Yuxuan Xia, Haomin Liu, Shengjie Wang
summary: A new sparse attention mechanism, HilbertA, balances spatial locality with GPU efficiency by reordering image tokens and employing a sliding schedule. It achieves comparable image quality while delivering significant acceleration on high-resolutio...
key_points: HilbertA balances 2D spatial locality with GPU efficiency
Employing a sliding schedule enables long-range information propagation
Significant acceleration achieved on high-resolution image generation
Comparable image quality to prior methods

title: TASP: Topology-aware Sequence Parallelism
authors: Yida Wang, Ke Hong, Xiuhong Li, Yuanchao Xu, Wenxun Wang, Guohao Dai, Yu Wang
summary: Researchers propose TASP, a topology-aware sequence parallelism method for large language models, to overcome communication efficiency limitations of Ring Attention on modern accelerators.
key_points: TASP decomposes accelerator topology into orthogonal ring datapaths
Improves communication efficiency compared to Ring Attention
Achieves up to 3.58 speedup over Zigzag-Ring Attention
Experimental results demonstrate improved performance on single-node and multi-node systems

title:
Secure ISAC with Fluid Antenna Systems: Joint Precoding and Port
  Selection
authors: Abdelhamid Salem, Hao Xu, Kai-Kit Wong, Chan-Byoung Chae, Yangyang Zhang
summary: A novel framework enhances physical-layer security in integrated sensing and communication systems by leveraging fluid antenna system reconfigurability.
key_points: Joint precoding and port selection strategy maximizes sum secrecy rate while ensuring reliable radar sensing
Fractional programming and successive convex approximation solve the problem iteratively
Low-complexity schemes reduce computational complexity using zero-forcing precoding and greedy port selection
Simulation results demonstrate substantial improvements in secrecy performance and sensing accuracy
FAS geometry optimization enables secure and efficient joint communication-sensing for next-generation wireless networks
